com.rubynaxela.citybusnavi.gui

Class DialogHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rubynaxela.citybusnavi.gui.DialogHandler

  • public final class DialogHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains dialog boxes derived into functions displaying the window and returning the received data

    • Method Detail

      • setAnchor

        public void setAnchor(java.awt.Component frame)
        Sets the parent Component of the dialogs. Must be called before showing any dialog window, otherwise the window will not be visible
        Parameters:
        frame - the parent Component of the dialogs

      • showInfo

        public void showInfo(java.lang.String message)
        Shows an info message
        Parameters:
        message - the message content

      • showWarning

        public void showWarning(java.lang.String message)
        Shows a warning message
        Parameters:
        message - the message content

      • showError

        public void showError(java.lang.String message,
                      boolean exitOnClose)
        Shows an error message
        Parameters:
        message - the message content
        exitOnClose - determines whether to close the application after the dialog box is dismissed

      • showError

        public void showError(java.lang.String message)
        Shows an error message
        Parameters:
        message - the message content

      • askYesNoQuestion

        public boolean askYesNoQuestion(java.lang.String message,
                                boolean defaultAnswer)
        Shows a YES-or-NO question dialog
        Parameters:
        message - the message content
        defaultAnswer - this answer will be highlighted when the window is displayed (true for Yes and false for No). It will be also used as the result if the window cannot be shown
        Returns:
        • true if the user answered Yes
        • false if the user answered No

      • askYesNoCancelQuestion

        public Trilean askYesNoCancelQuestion(java.lang.String message)
        Shows a YES-NO-CANCEL question dialog. The default answer is the Cancel option (Trilean.NEUTRAL)
        Parameters:
        message - the message content
        Returns:
        • Trilean.POSITIVE if the user answered Yes
        • Trilean.NEGATIVE if the user answered No
        • Trilean.NEUTRAL if the user answered Cancel

      • chooseFileToLoad

        public java.io.File chooseFileToLoad(java.lang.String... extensions)
        Opens a file selection dialog in load mode
        Parameters:
        extensions - list of accepted file extensions. If empty, any extension is accepted
        Returns:
        file chosen by the user

      • chooseFileToSave

        public java.io.File chooseFileToSave(java.lang.String proposedName,
                                     java.lang.String... extensions)
        Opens a file selection dialog in save mode
        Parameters:
        proposedName - the default file name
        extensions - list of accepted file extensions. If empty, any extension is accepted
        Returns:
        file chosen by the user
